Employment
 
Work Time Window
 

How Company Work Time and Restricted Days Work

  • The Company Work Time Window sets the maximum timeframe when employees are allowed to clock in and out, allowing for controlled overtime.
  • Restricted Work Days block clock-ins on specific days.
  • If employees clock in outside these settings, they’ll see: "Clock-in/out is not allowed outside defined hours or on restricted days."
  • This setup provides flexibility and ensures a controlled schedule.
Job Responsibility
 
Leave Entitlement
 
 
Leave Policy
 

Leave Policies Explained

  • No Carryover: Unused leave resets to zero at the start of each new calendar year.
  • Regular Policy: When "Regular" is selected, leave days are granted upfront and deducted with each approved request. Accrual fields are disabled.
  • Accrual Policy: When "Accrual" is selected, employees earn leave progressively. Leave balance builds up and deducts during use; regular leave fields are disabled.
  • Changing from Regular to Accrual: The system starts accruing leave for the rest of the year based on the company's accrual formula.
  • Changing from Accrual to Regular: The accrued leave balance is rounded up to the nearest full day and converted into regular leave.

Tip: It's best to avoid changing leave policy mid-year unless necessary to prevent confusion for employees.
